intro: Pavetta macraei, commonly known as the large-leaved pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pavetta macraei is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
